--0-1370660930-1298362607=:42661
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii



Hello,

I am working towards an indexing project for Heritrix archived files. As an initial stage, I am trying to read gzipped archive files generated by heritrix 1.14.4.

When I try to use the command line utility provided with heritrix named arcreader.cmd, it works fine. But, I want to use ARCReader class in my own class to make a manageable reading process of multiple archive files. When I try to get ARCReader using ARCReaderFactory with filename and offset as argument, it seems to work fine, but when i do not provide any offset, it gives me IOException with this message:"resetting to invalid mark".

I tried giving exactly same arguments to ARCReader using eclipse as we pass from command line, but, the result was same exception in case of no offset provided. Following is the error stacktrace:

Exception in thread "main" java.io.IOException: Resetting to invalid mark
    at java.io.BufferedInputStream.reset(Unknown Source)
    at org.archive.io.GzippedInputStream.<init>(GzippedInputStream.java:129)
    at org.archive.io.GzippedInputStream.<init>(GzippedInputStream.java:90)
    at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReaderFactory$CompressedARCReader.<init>(ARCReaderFactory.java:350)
    at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReaderFactory.getArchiveReader(ARCReaderFactory.java:122)
    at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReaderFactory.get(ARCReaderFactory.java:106)
    at org.archive.io.ArchiveReaderFactory.getArchiveReader(ArchiveReaderFactory.java:122)
    at org.archive.io.ArchiveReaderFactory.get(ArchiveReaderFactory.java:115)
    at org.archive.io.ArchiveReaderFactory.getArchiveReader(ArchiveReaderFactory.java:90)
    at org.archive.io.ArchiveReaderFactory.getArchiveReader(ArchiveReaderFactory.java:82)
    at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReaderFactory.get(ARCReaderFactory.java:70)
    at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.main(ARCReader.java:816)

Please let me know if anyone has idea if i need any special argument so that it can mark and reset input stream correctly. Let me know if you think there is not sufficient data available to help. Thanks in advance.

- Darshan Karia.
